Trnsplanstat.title: Trns.plan.stat.
Trnsplanstat.description:
Transportation planning status  
Indicates the extent to which transportation planning has been performed.  
This characteristic controls the selection of deliveries to make up shipments in transportation planning. It is used a selection criterion for finding deliveries.  
The indicator is set by the system on the basis of the leg indicator (preliminary, subsequent, direct, return) in the headers of the shipment documents to which the delivery has been assigned.  
Blank - Not relevant  
        Delivery is not to be processed in transportation  
        planning. This is the case when:  
         - the delivery type is not relevant for transportation, or  
         - the route is not relevant for transportation (only for  
           outbound deliveries; not required for  
           inbound deliveries), or  
         - a shipment block has been set in the delivery (only for  
           outbound deliveries: not required for inbound deliveries)  
A     - Not yet planned  
        Delivery is to be processed in transportation planning.  
        It has not yet been assigned to a shipment document.  
B     - Partially planned  
        Delivery is to be processed in transportation  
        planning. The delivery has already been  
        assigned to at least one shipment document but the  
        transportation chain is not complete (see status C).  
C     - Completely planned  
        Delivery has been assigned to one or more  
        shipment documents in transportation planning. Depending  
        on the leg indicator in each shipment header, the delivery is  
        considered to be completely planned if  
          - it exists in a direct leg or a return leg or  
          - it exists in a preliminary, main, subsequent leg or  
          - each stage assigned to the delivery connects to a  
            subsequent stage, thus connecting the point  
            of departure with the destination of the delivery with  
            no gaps in transportation (as of Release 4.6A).

Confirmation.title: Confirmation
Confirmation.description:
Status of pick confirmation  
The confirmation status of the outbound delivery indicates whether picking must be explicitly confirmed for the delivery or whether picking has already been confirmed.  
The confirmation status is only relevant if you are not using WM transfer orders for picking.  
You can contol whether outbound deliveries that are processed using this shipping point should be subject to confirmation in Customizing for the Shipping Point.

SAPRelease.title: SAP Release
SAPRelease.description:
Release status of the SAP System for which the screen variant has been generated.  
A screen variant is generated when saving or when a CO actual posting is first called after a release change.

Itdatapackag.title: It.data packag.
Itdatapackag.description:
Totals incomplete status for all items: packaging  
Incomplete status of the item data in the sales document that is relevant for shipping.  
If shipping-related item data from the sales order is missing, the system will set the status to incomplete. You cannot ship an item with incomplete shipping data. For example, if no shipping point has been specified for an item, that item cannot be shipped.  
If you try to save a document and data is still missing, the system will inform you that the document is incomplete. You can then either retrieve a list of the fields concerned and enter the missing data, or you can save the incomplete document and enter the missing data at a later time.

Itdatapckputaway.title: It.data pck/putaway
Itdatapckputaway.description:
Totals incomplete status for all items: Picking  
Incomplete status of the item data in the sales document that is relevant for shipping.  
If shipping-related item data from the sales order is missing, the system will set the status to incomplete. You cannot ship an item with incomplete shipping data. For example, if no shipping point has been specified for an item, that item cannot be shipped.  
If you try to save a document and data is still missing, the system will inform you that the document is incomplete. You can then either retrieve a list of the fields concerned and enter the missing data, or you can save the incomplete document and enter the missing data at a later time.

ItemdataGM.title: Item data: GM
ItemdataGM.description:
Total incomplete status of all items: post goods movement  
Incompletion status of item data in the sales document that affects shipping.  
If shipping-related item data from the sales order is missing, the system sets the status to incomplete. An item with incomplete shipping data cannot be transmitted. If an item does not, for example, contain any specifications on the shipping point, you cannot transmit it.  
If you attempt to save a document where data is missing, the system will  point out that the document is incomplete. You can then call up a list of the fields with missing specifications and complete them. However, you can also save the incomplete document and supply the missing data at a later time.

Headdatapckg.title: Head.data pckg.
Headdatapckg.description:
Header incomplete status for packaging  
Incomplete status of the billing-related header data in the sales document.  
This status indicates whether the billing-related header data is incomplete. Incomplete sales documents cannot be billed. For example, you cannot create an invoice for a sales document that does not specify the terms of payment.  
If you try to save a document and data is still missing, the system will inform you that the document is incomplete. You can then either retrieve a list of the fields concerned and enter the missing data, or you can save the incomplete document and enter the missing data at a later time.

Headdatapckputawy.title: Head.data pck/putawy
Headdatapckputawy.description:
Header incomplete status for picking/putaway  
Incomplete status of the billing-related header data in the sales document.  
This status indicates whether the billing-related header data is incomplete. Incomplete sales documents cannot be billed. For example, you cannot create an invoice for a sales document that does not specify the terms of payment.  
If you try to save a document and data is still missing, the system will inform you that the document is incomplete. You can then either retrieve a list of the fields concerned and enter the missing data, or you can save the incomplete document and enter the missing data at a later time.

HeaddataGM.title: Head. data GM
HeaddataGM.description:
Post header incomplete status for goods movement  
Incomplete status of the billing-related header data in the sales document.  
This status indicates whether the billing-related header data is incomplete. Incomplete sales documents cannot be billed. For example, you cannot create an invoice for a sales document that does not specify the terms of payment.  
If you try to save a document and data is still missing, the system will inform you that the document is incomplete. You can then either retrieve a list of the fields concerned and enter the missing data, or you can save the incomplete document and enter the missing data at a later time.

Headdatadangds.title: Head.data dan.gds
Headdatadangds.description:
UNUSED  
Incomplete status of the billing-related header data in the sales document.  
This status indicates whether the billing-related header data is incomplete. Incomplete sales documents cannot be billed. For example, you cannot create an invoice for a sales document that does not specify the terms of payment.  
If you try to save a document and data is still missing, the system will inform you that the document is incomplete. You can then either retrieve a list of the fields concerned and enter the missing data, or you can save the incomplete document and enter the missing data at a later time.

Delaystatus.title: Delay status
Delaystatus.description:
This status shows whether an order contains undelivered order quantities which are or are not available for the commitment date.  
If none of the items in the order are available for the commitment date, the order is given the 'delayed' status. If at least one item in the order is delayed, the order is given the status 'partially delayed'.  
An item is then 'delayed' if the committed quantity can only be partially confirmed, or confirmed at a later date.

HUinstock.title: HU in stock
HUinstock.description:
Handling Unit Placed in Stock  
This field shows whether at least one handling unit in the delivery is in WM stock.  
If an additional handling unit of the delivery has been placed in WM stock, goods issue cannot be posted for the delivery.

StatDecntrlWhse.title: StatDecntrlWhse
StatDecntrlWhse.description:
Distribution Status (Decentralized Warehouse Processing)  
This field displays the processing status of the delivery in terms of decentralized Warehouse Management System processing. This field cannot be changed manually. Instead, the system determines the status using delivery items' warehouse numbers and the delivery processing status.  
In the central system, this field may contain the following characteristics:  
' ': delivery is not relevant for distribution to a decentralized WM System.  
'A':  delivery is relevant for distribution in the decentralized system. When the delivery is saved, an IDoc is created. The system then uses this IDoc to distribute the delivery in the decentralized system.  
'B':  delivery was distributed in the decentralized system and is currently being processed there.  
'C':  processing of the delivery in the decentralized system is complete. Any changes are confirmed in the central system.  
'D': The delivery is planned for distribution in the decentralized system. You can trigger distribution using the delivery monitor.  
'E': The delivery was subsequently split in the decentralized system. In this case, no further changes can be made to the document in the central system.  
'F':  Change management was subsequently switched off. For example, because the central system was temporarily not available. The delivery can no longer be changed in the central system.  
This field may contain the following characteristics in the decentralized Warehouse Management System:  
'A':  delivery is being processed.  
'C':  processing of this delivery in the decentral system is complete. The delivery is confirmed in the central system via goods issue or goods receipt posting. The delivery can no longer be changed in the decentral system.  
'E': The delivery was split in the decentralized system. The delivery can then be changed, however, only changes to the delivery quantity are returned to the central system.  
'F':  Change management was subsequently switched off. The delivery can only be changed in the decentralized system. Only changes to the delivery quantity are reported back to the central system.  
Statuses 'B' and 'D' do not occur in this system.

Revdetstatus.title: Rev.det. status
Revdetstatus.description:
Revenue determination status  
Represents the settlement status of an amount that is relevant to revenue recognition. The amount can be a time-related accrual for a posting period within the settlement period for a sales item, or it  can be calculated according to the business transaction for revenue recognition, for example goods receipt. In the status line the system displays whether the amount has already been recognized as revenue, either partially or completely.

Ovbblkstat.title: Ov. b.blk stat.
Ovbblkstat.description:
Overall billing block status  
The value of the overall billing block field is calculated using the:  
Billing block status of item + sales document billing block + user status header

Dlvblkstatus.title: Dlv. blk status
Dlvblkstatus.description:
Overall delivery block status  
The value of this field is calculated using the following values:  
Item delivery block status + Document header delivery block + user status for header

Overallblkst.title: Overall blk st.
Overallblkst.description:
Overall blocked status  
Overall blocked status.  
The value of this field is calculated according to the following values:  
Overall header delivery block status + overall header billing block status + header credit check status

PODstatus.title: POD status
PODstatus.description:
POD status on header level  
Proof of delivery status (POD status) for the entire delivery.  
The status informs you whether the ship-to party reported a POD for this delivery:  
This status can have the following values:  
' ' Not relevant for the POD process  
'A' Relevant for the POD process  
'B' Differences were reported  
'C' Quantities were verified and confirmed  
If all item quantities of a delivery are reported with no differences, the process is confirmed automatically. If differences are reported, the proof of delivery must be confirmed manually.

Temp.title: Temp
Temp.description:
Temporary inbound delivery  
Represents the status of an inbound delivery. The following stati are possible:  
Blank : Real (non -temporary) delivery  
1 :   Temp.ID is waiting for acknowledgement to change ID  
2 :   Temp.ID is waiting for acknowledgement to delete ID  
3 :   Temp.ID is waiting for acknowledgement to purge ID  
4 :   Temp.ID is waiting for acknowledgement to delete (caused by redirecting)  
The different stati are set depending on the action performed on the inbound deliveries.  
If the inbound deliveries that are processed in EWM should be deleted,  EWM has to acknowledge this deletion. In this case, a new temporary inbound delivery is created in the ERP system and the status of the temporary inbound delivery is set  to 'Temp. ID is waiting for acknowledgement to delete ID'.

Hold.title: Hold
Hold.description:
Inbound delivery header not yet complete (on Hold)  
Speficifies whether the inbound delivery is a delivery on hold or not.  
Hint:  
Once an inbound delivery has been saved, it cannot be processed with the function Put on Hold at a later point in time.

PHold.title: PHold
PHold.description:
At least one of ID items not yet complete (on Hold)  
Speficifies whether the inbound delivery is a delivery on hold or not.  
Hint:  
Once an inbound delivery has been saved, it cannot be processed with the function Put on Hold at a later point in time.

DocumentCat.title: Document Cat.
DocumentCat.description: Field is not supported  needed for technical reasons only

Client.title: Client
Client.description: A legally and organizationally independent unit which uses the system.

SalesDocument.title: Sales Document
SalesDocument.description:
Sales and Distribution Document Number  
The number that uniquely identifies the sales, delivery, or billing document.

Item1.title: Item
Item1.description:
Item number of the SD document  
The number that uniquely identifies the item in the sales, shipping, or billing document.

Referencestat1.title: Reference stat.
Referencestat1.description:
Reference status  
Shows if, and to what extent, the item has already been referenced by other sales documents.  
The status message tells you whether one or more other sales documents have referenced this item partially, completely, or not at all.  
You create a sales order by copying an item from a quotation. However, when you process the order, you reduce the item quantity. If you later check the reference status for this quotation item, the system tells you that it has been partially referenced.

Referencestat2.title: Reference stat.
Referencestat2.description:
Overall status of reference  
The overall processing status of the referenced item.  
The system determines the overall processing status of the item by taking into account  
The status of the referenced item (whether it is relevant for reference, and, if so, to what extent it has been referenced)  
The rejection status of the item  
The status message can tell you, for example, that an unreferenced item has nevertheless been "completed" because it has been rejected.

Deliverystatus.title: Delivery status
Deliverystatus.description:
Displays the delivery status of the item.  
The status line tells you if the item is not yet delivered, is partly delivered, is completely delivered, or is not relevant for delivery.

Overalldlvst.title: Overall dlv.st.
Overalldlvst.description:
Overall delivery status of the item  
Displays the delivery status of the item.  
The status line tells you if the item is not yet delivered, is partly delivered, is completely delivered, or is not relevant for delivery.

GoodsMovementSt.title: GoodsMovementSt
GoodsMovementSt.description:
Goods movement status  
The status shows if a goods issue or receipt has taken place for a delivery item.  
The status provides the following information:  
For an outbound delivery, the status informs you whether the item has already left the warehouse or company premises, or still being processed.  
For an inbound delivery, the system shows you whether the goods have already been received, or are waiting to be received.  
The status also informs you whether or not an item is relevant for delivery. A text item is not relevant, for example.

BillingStatus1.title: Billing Status
BillingStatus1.description:
Billing status of delivery-related billing documents  
Displays the billing status of the item.  
The status line tells you if the item is not yet billed, is partly billed, is completely billed, or is not relevant for billing.

BillingStatus2.title: Billing Status
BillingStatus2.description:
Billing Status for Order-Related Billing Documents  
The order-related billing status shows to what extent an item has been processed for billing.  
You determine whether an item is billed as an order-related or delivery-related item when you define item category defaults through the Customizing menus.  
Credit and debit memo items, for example, are billed as order-related items.

Rejectionstat.title: Rejection stat.
Rejectionstat.description:
Rejection status for SD item  
Indicates whether the sales document item (for example, an item in a quotation) is rejected.  
The system uses the rejection status of items to determine the rejection status at the header level. For example, if a customer rejects only one of several items in a quotation, the status of the header shows that the quotation is partly rejected.

Overallstatus.title: Overall status
Overallstatus.description:
Overall processing status of the SD document item  
Displays the overall processing status of the item.  
The system determines the overall status from all statuses (for example, delivery and billing) for this item. The status message tells you whether processing of the item is open, in progress, or complete.

Pickingstatus.title: Picking status
Pickingstatus.description:
Picking status/Putaway status  
The picking/putaway status of the delivery item.  
The status message tells you whether the item is relevant for delivery. If the item is relevant for delivery, the status indicates whether picking/putaway has:  
Begun  
Been partially carried out  
Been completed  
Picking/putaway is not relevant for some items, for example, text items or service items.

WMactivstatus.title: WM activ.status
WMactivstatus.description:
Status of warehouse management activities  
Indicates the warehouse management status of the delivery item.  
If your delivery processing includes the SAP Warehouse Management (WM) system, the system automatically indicates the WM status for each item in a delivery.

Item2.title: Item
Item2.description:
General Incompletion Status of Item  
Displays the status of all information that applies to this item.  
The status line tells you if all item information, necessary for further processing this item, is complete.

Itemdelivdata.title: Item deliv.data
Itemdelivdata.description:
Incompletion status of the item with regard to delivery  
Displays the status of delivery-related information that applies to this item.  
The status line tells you if delivery-related item information is complete. You must enter this information, if you want to process the item further.  
A sales order item is incomplete for delivery processing if, for example, you do not enter a shipping point. You cannot deliver the item until you provide this information.

Itembilldata.title: Item bill.data
Itembilldata.description:
Item Incompletion Status with Respect to Billing  
Displays the incompletion status of billing-related information that applies to this item.  
The status line tells you to what extent the information necessary for billing the item is complete.  
A sales order item, for example, is incomplete for billing if prices are missing. You cannot bill the item until you provide the missing information.

Confirmation.title: Confirmation
Confirmation.description:
Confirmation status of picking/putaway  
Indicates the pick/putaway confirmation status for a delivery item.  
When you create a delivery with an item subject to pick/putaway confirmation, the item is assigned the status A (Subject to confirmation but not yet confirmed). Once you confirm the pick/putaway, the system assigns either status B (Partially confirmed) or C (Fully confirmed).  
Goods movement cannot be posted for items subject to pick/putaway confirmation until the pick/putaway quantities for the items have been fully confirmed.

Financialdoc.title: Financial doc.
Financialdoc.description: Status of credit check against financial document

ExptCreditInsur.title: ExptCreditInsur
ExptCreditInsur.description: Status of credit check against export credit insurance

Itemdatapckputawy.title: Item data pck/putawy
Itemdatapckputawy.description:
Incomplete status of item for picking/putaway  
Displays the status of the delivery-related data for this item.  
The status indicates whether the delivery-related item data is complete. You must enter these data if you want to further process the item.  
For example, a sales order item is incomplete for delivery processing if you do not specify a shipping point. You cannot deliver the item unless you have entered these data.

Itdatapckgng.title: It.data pckgng
Itdatapckgng.description:
Incomplete status of item for packaging  
Displays the incomplete status of billing-relevant data for this item.  
The status indicates the degree to which the data required for billing the item are complete.  
For example, a sales order item is incomplete for billing if prices are missing. You cannot bill the item unless you have entered the missing data.

ItemdataGM.title: Item data: GM
ItemdataGM.description:
Incomplete status of item regarding goods issue  
Shows the incompletion status of data relevant for billing documents that concerns this item.  
The status provides information on how far the data required for billing the item is complete.  
A sales document item is incomplete for billing, for example, if price specifications are missing. You can only invoice the item if you have completed the missing data.

Delaystatus.title: Delay status
Delaystatus.description:
This status shows whether an order item is available for the commitment date or not.  
If it is not available, the order item has the status 'delayed'.  
An item is "delayed", if the committed quantity can only be partially confirmed, or confirmed for a later date.

Revdetstatus.title: Rev.det. status
Revdetstatus.description:
Revenue determination status  
Represents the settlement status of an amount that is relevant to revenue recognition. The amount can be a time-related accrual for a posting period within the settlement period for a sales item, or it  can be calculated according to the business transaction for revenue recognition, for example goods receipt. In the status line the system displays whether the amount has already been recognized as revenue, either partially or completely.

Bblockstatus.title: B. block status
Bblockstatus.description:
Billing block status for items  
The value of the field in the billing block status for the item is calculated from:  
Sales document: Billing block item + User status item.

Dlvblkstatus.title: Dlv. blk status
Dlvblkstatus.description:
Delivery block status for item  
Delivery block status for item  
The value of this field is calculated using the:  
Schedule line delivery block + item user status

PODstatus.title: POD status
PODstatus.description:
POD status on item level  
Proof of delivery status (POD status) per item  
The status message informs you whether the ship-to party reported a proof of delivery for this item.  
This status may have the following values for a delivery item:  
' ' Not relevant for the POD process  
'A' Relevant for the POD process  
'B' Differences were reported  
'C' Quantities were verified and confirmed

DlyItemNotComp.title: DlyItemNotComp.
DlyItemNotComp.description:
Inbound Delivery Item Not Yet Complete (on Hold)  
Specifies whether the inbound delivery is a delivery on hold or not.  
By using the function Put on Hold, you can store inbound deliveries that contain errors or are incomplete in the SAP System.  
Inbound deliveries on hold are used when there are errors in the inbound delivery document, such as when the material number does not exist in the system or no order data has been entered. You can process and complete such inbound deliveries on hold at a later point in time.  
The following functions are not available for inbound deliveries on hold:  
Packing  
Placing in storage  
Goods receipt posting

Client.title: Client
Client.description: A legally and organizationally independent unit which uses the system.

PrecedingDoc.title: Preceding Doc.
PrecedingDoc.description:
Preceding sales and distribution document  
Number that uniquely identifies the preceding sales, delivery, or billing document (for example, the quotation from which you created a sales order).

Precedingitem.title: Preceding item
Precedingitem.description: Preceding item of an SD document

Followondoc.title: Follow-on doc.
Followondoc.description:
Subsequent sales and distribution document  
Number that uniquely identifies the subsequent sales, delivery, or billing document (for example, the sales order that you create from a previous quotation).

Subsequentitem.title: Subsequent item
Subsequentitem.description:
Subsequent item of an SD document  
Number that uniquely identifies the item in the subsequent document (for example, in a sales order that you created from a quotation).

Subsdoccateg.title: Subs.doc.categ.
Subsdoccateg.description:
Document category of subsequent document  
The document category of the sales document that you have created from a preceding document (for example, a delivery note that has been created from a sales order).

Quantity1.title: Quantity
Quantity1.description:
Referenced quantity in base unit of measure  
Specifies how much of an item quantity has already been processed in a subsequent document. The referenced quantity is expressed in basic stock units.  
A sales order item has an order quantity of 100 pieces. You create two delivery notes against the order: the first for 20 pieces, the second for 80 pieces. In the first case, the referenced quantity is 20 pieces; in the second case, 80 pieces.

BaseUnit.title: Base Unit
BaseUnit.description:
Base Unit of Measure  
Unit of measure in which stocks of the material are managed. The system converts all the quantities you enter in other units of measure (alternative units of measure) to the base unit of measure.  
You define the base unit of measure and also alternative units of measure and their conversion factors in the material master record.  
Since all data is updated in the base unit of measure, your entry is particularly important for the conversion of alternative units of measure. A quantity in the alternative unit of measure can only be shown precisely if its value can be shown with the decimal places available. To ensure this, please note the following:  
The base unit of measure is the unit satisfying the highest necessary requirement for precision.  
The conversion of alternative units of measure to the base unit should result in simple decimal fractions (not, for example, 1/3 = 0.333...).  
Inventory Management  
In Inventory Management, the base unit of measure is the same as the stockkeeping unit.  
Services  
Services have units of measure of their own, including the following:  
Service unit  
Unit of measure at the higher item level. The precise quantities of the individual services are each at the detailed service line level.  
Blanket  
Unit of measure at service line level for services to be provided once only, and for which no precise quantities can or are to be specified.

Referencevalue.title: Reference value
Referencevalue.description:
Specifies how much of an item value has already been processed in a subsequent document. The referenced value is expressed in the local currency.  
For sales documents, the value is based on the sales price of the material. For goods issue, the value is based on the stock price of the material.  
A quotation item is worth $100. You create two sales order items from the quotation: the first is worth $20, the second $80. In the first case, the referenced value is $20; in the second case, $80.

StatsCurrency.title: Stats Currency
StatsCurrency.description:
Statistics currency  
The currency that the system automatically proposes for statistics that you generate for a particular sales organization.  
You can define a default currency for each sales organization. When you generate sales statistics, the system automatically proposes the default. You can overwrite the default.

Precdoccateg.title: Prec.doc.categ.
Precdoccateg.description:
Document category of preceding SD document  
Specifies the sales document category of the preceding sales, delivery, or billing document.

Posnegative.title: Pos./ negative
Posnegative.description:
Quantity is calculated positively, negatively or not at all  
Indicates whether, during copying, the quantity or value in the target document has a negative effect, positive effect, or no effect at all on the quantity still to be completed in the source document.  
The system uses this indicator to determine how the quantity in the source document is affected. For example, if you  
Create a quotation item for 100 pieces,  
Copy the quotation into a sales order, and  
Create a sales order item for 80 pieces,  
the copying has a positive effect on the quotation. In effect, you have added 80 pieces to the quotation quantity that is now considered complete. 20 pieces in the quotation remain to be completed.  
If you do not make an entry in this field, or set indicator 0, the source document is not blocked, which allows you to create several target documents at once (for example, when using EDI and frequent contract releases).  
While the source document (such as quotation or quantity contract) is being processed, it is blocked. For instance, if you are working on a quantity contract, no one can create a release order for that contract).  
In sales documents, for example, you can expect the following results:  
Quotation   -> Sales order: positive  
Contract    -> Return: negative  
Sales order -> Sales order: no effect  
In billing documents, for example, you can expect the following results:  
Delivery    -> Invoice: positive  
Delivery    -> Cancellation: negative  
Delivery    -> Pro-forma invoice: no effect

ConfirmationID.title: Confirmation ID
ConfirmationID.description:
ID: MM-WM transfer order confirmed  
Indicates whether the transfer order in the warehouse management (WM) system is confirmed.

Time.title: Time
Time.description:
Entry time  
The time of day at which the document was posted and stored in the system.

Material1.title: Material
Material1.description:
Material Number  
Alphanumeric key uniquely identifying the material.

Movementtype.title: Movement type
Movementtype.description:
Movement type (inventory management)  
Specifies a key for the type of goods movement. Each goods movement (for example, purchase order to warehouse) is allocated to a movement type in the system.

RequirementType.title: RequirementType
RequirementType.description:
Requirement type  
Determines the way in which the system handles requirements planning.  
You can use the requirement type to control, for example, lot sizing, inventory management, and storage costs. When you create a sales order, for example, you can specify a requirement type for each schedule line. During sales order and delivery processing, the requirement type, in combination with the planning type controls whether the system  
Generates requirements  
Checks availability  
The schedule line category determines the requirements type. You cannot change the requirements type during sales order processing.

Planningtype.title: Planning type
Planningtype.description:
Determines the way in which the system handles requirements planning.  
You can use the planning type to control, for example, lot sizing, inventory management, and storage costs. When you create a sales order, for example, you can specify a planning type for each schedule line. During sales order and delivery processing, the planning type, in combination with the requirements type controls whether the system  
Generates requirements  
Checks availability  
The schedule line category determines the planning type. You cannot change the planning type during sales order processing.

Level.title: Level
Level.description: Level of the document flow record

WarehouseNo.title: Warehouse No.
WarehouseNo.description:
Warehouse Number / Warehouse Complex  
Number that identifies a complex, physical warehouse structure within the Warehouse Management system.  
All activities within a warehouse, for example, goods movements and physical inventory, are assigned to a specific warehouse number. The physical warehouse where these activities take place is identified by the warehouse number.

BillingCategory.title: BillingCategory
BillingCategory.description:
Billing category  
Indicates whether the billing document refers to a sales order or a delivery.

Grossweight.title: Gross weight
Grossweight.description:
The total gross weight of all items in the delivery. The gross weight represents the net weight plus the weight of packaging.  
The system calculates the gross weight of each item by multiplying the delivery quantity by the gross weight per unit that comes from the sales order. If there is no related sales order, the system uses the gross weight from the material master record.  
You can change the gross weight manually in the delivery document.

WeightUnit.title: Weight Unit
WeightUnit.description:
Unit referring to the gross weight or net weight of the material.  
If you specify a weight, you must enter the corresponding unit of weight here.

Volume.title: Volume
Volume.description:
The total volume of all items in the delivery.  
The system calculates the volume for each item by multiplying the delivery quantity by the volume per unit that comes from the sales order. If there is no related sales order, the system uses the volume from the material master record.  
You can change the volume manually in the delivery document.

VolumeUnit.title: Volume Unit
VolumeUnit.description:
Unit referring to the volume of the material.  
If you specify a volume, you have to enter the corresponding volume unit here.

BillingPlanNo.title: Billing Plan No
BillingPlanNo.description: Billing Plan Number / Invoicing Plan Number

Item.title: Item
Item.description: Item for billing plan/invoice plan/payment cards

Quantity3.title: Quantity
Quantity3.description: Referenced quantity in base unit of measure (float)

SalesUnit.title: Sales Unit
SalesUnit.description: Unit of measure in which the material is sold.

SpecialStock.title: Special Stock
SpecialStock.description:
Special Stock Indicator  
Specifies the special stock type.  
If you need to separately manage certain stock (for example, consignment stock) of a material, the stock type in question is defined using this indicator.

SpecStockNo.title: Spec.Stock No.
SpecStockNo.description:
Special Stock Number  
Number that identifies a stock of material with a <GL:special stock>special stock indicator.  
In the case of consignment stock, for example, this number is the supplier number.

InvMgmtactive.title: Inv.Mgmt active
InvMgmtactive.description:
Indicator Inventory Management active  
Indicates whether a stock search for the transfer order item was active.  
When using the stock search task, you can determine a strategy for on picking consignment stock or your own stock.

NetWeight.title: Net Weight
NetWeight.description: Net weight expressed in the unit of weight specified by you in the Unit of weight field.

LogicalSystem.title: Logical System
LogicalSystem.description:
System in which applications run integrated on a shared data basis.  
The distribution of data between systems requires that each system in the network has a unique identification. The logical system is used for this purpose.  
In the SAP System the client corresponds to a logical system. You can assign a logical system to a client in the client maintenance (choose Goto -> Detail).  
The logical system is relevant in the following SAP areas:  
ALE  general: two or more logical systems communicate with one another.  
ALE - ALE business processes (for example, cost center accounting): definition of a system where a specific application runs. Changes to master data can only be made in this system, for example.  
Workflow objects: the logical system in which the object is located is always included in an object's key.  
When maintaining the logical system, note the following:  
The logical system must be unique company-wide. It must not be used by any other system in the ALE integrated group. In a production system, the logical system must not be changed. If the logical system of a document reference is not set to initial and does not match your own, the system assumes the document is located in a different system.

GoodsMovementSt.title: GoodsMovementSt
GoodsMovementSt.description:
Goods movement status  
The status shows if a goods issue or receipt has taken place for a delivery item.  
The status provides the following information:  
For an outbound delivery, the status informs you whether the item has already left the warehouse or company premises, or still being processed.  
For an inbound delivery, the system shows you whether the goods have already been received, or are waiting to be received.  
The status also informs you whether or not an item is relevant for delivery. A text item is not relevant, for example.

ConvMethod.title: Conv. Method
ConvMethod.description:
Quantity Conversion Method  
The conversion method controls the oil quantity conversion calculations that are performed for the material.  
The conversion method is set depending on the oil-specific data that is entered in the material master, as described below:  
[] (space) Neither conversion group or tax group maintained  
If the conversion mode is blank standard (no IS-Oil enhancements), routines are used to perform standard quantity conversion calculations.  
1   Conversion group maintained  
Oil quantity conversion routines defined from the conversion group are used to perform quantity conversions, with conversions being performed for all the units of measure within the unit of measure group.  
2   Tax group, but no conversion group, maintained  
Standard routines are used to perform the quantity calculations, but conversions are performed for all the units of measure within the unit of measure group.  
Unit of measure group and Conversion group

MatDocYear.title: Mat. Doc. Year
MatDocYear.description:
Material Document Year  
Calendar year in which the material document was posted.  
In conjunction with the document number, the material document year constitutes the key via which a material document is accessed.

Material2.title: Material
Material2.description:
Material Number (40 Characters, needed f. technical reasons)  
Technical field to be used in communication structures for compatibility reasons.

DocumentCat1.title: Document Cat.
DocumentCat1.description: Field is not supported  needed for technical reasons only

DocumentCat2.title: Document Cat.
DocumentCat2.description: Field is not supported  needed for technical reasons only

Client.title: Client
Client.description: A legally and organizationally independent unit which uses the system.

Fortrdatano.title: For.tr.data no.
Fortrdatano.description:
Number of foreign trade data in MM and SD documents  
Internal number for export data.

Delivcountry.title: Deliv.country
Delivcountry.description:
Delivering country  
Identifies, during export, the country from which goods are shipped and, during import, the country into which goods are delivered.  
As a rule, you use the international identification codes for motor vehicles (for example, USA = United States, I = Italy, and so on). The system uses the country key to determine:  
Taxes relevant during pricing  
Important country-specific norms, such as the length of postal codes and bank account numbers.  
You define the country keys you need in Customizing.

ModeOfTrBorder.title: ModeOfTr-Border
ModeOfTrBorder.description:
Mode of Transport for Foreign Trade  
Identifies the mode of transport (for example: road, rail, or sea) by which the goods cross a border during export or import.  
This information is required for the declaration of Foreign Trade data.

Customsoffice.title: Customs office
Customsoffice.description:
Customs Office: Office of Exit/Entry for Foreign Trade  
Specifies the code of the customs office through which the goods enter or leave the country.  
This information is used for compiling export/import data for foreign trade statistics.  
The code that you enter depends upon your location, for example:  
Within the European Union (EU), you enter the code of the domestic harbor or airport at which the goods cross the border and are loaded onto or unloaded from the means of transport.  
In the United States, you enter the code that is assigned to the relevant US export harbor in the Schedule D directory.

Officeofdest.title: Office of dest.
Officeofdest.description:
Customs office: Office of destination for foreign trade  
The last customs office, through which the goods have to pass before the ship-to party receives them.

Customsoffice1.title: Customs office1
Customsoffice1.description:
Customs office: Customs office 1 for foreign trade  
A customs office between the office of exit and the office of destination.

Customsoffice2.title: Customs office2
Customsoffice2.description:
Customs office: Customs office 2 for foreign trade  
A customs office between the office of exit and the office of destination.

Customsoffice3.title: Customs office3
Customsoffice3.description:
Customs office: Customs office 3 for foreign trade  
A customs office between the office of exit and the office of destination.

Customsoffice4.title: Customs office4
Customsoffice4.description:
Customs office: Customs office 4 for foreign trade  
A customs office between the office of exit and the office of destination.

Customsoffice5.title: Customs office5
Customsoffice5.description:
Customs office: Customs office 5 for foreign trade  
A customs office between the office of exit and the office of destination.

Customsoffice6.title: Customs office6
Customsoffice6.description:
Customs office: Customs office 6 for foreign trade  
A customs office between the office of exit and the office of destination.

CrossborderMT.title: Cross.border MT
CrossborderMT.description:
Indicator for means of transport crossing the border  
Identification for means of transport across borders. In any case, you have to specify the type of the means of transport (truck, ship, plane) that will probably be used for crossing the external border of a trade area.

Meansoftransp.title: Means of transp
Meansoftransp.description:
Indicator for the means of transport at departure  
Identification for means of transport for outward movement of goods. This can be, for example, the indicator or the name of the means of transport (truck, ship, freight car, plane) onto which the goods are loaded when they are presented to the customs office.

OriginMTBorder.title: OriginMT-Border
OriginMTBorder.description: Origin of Means of Transport when Crossing the Border

OrigCtryDepar.title: OrigCtry-Depar.
OrigCtryDepar.description: Country of Origin of the Means of Transport at Departure

Container.title: Container
Container.description:
ID: Goods cross border in a container  
Indicates whether, during export, the goods are shipped by container.

Currency1.title: Currency
Currency1.description:
Currency of statistical values for foreign trade  
The currency that applies to the statistical value.  
As a rule, the currency is the same as the local currency of the company that is processing the export/import document.

DoModeOfTransp.title: DoModeOfTransp.
DoModeOfTransp.description:
Domestic Mode of Transport for Foreign Trade  
Means of transport which is used when goods leave the point of departure during export or reach the point of destination during import. If the means-of-transport type is not known, you can specify the means of transport which would normally be used for goods in similar cases.  
[ Article 10 Para 1 Letter g), Council Regulation (EG) No. 1172/95   from May 22, 1995, for goods traffic with third countries ].

ExclIncl.title: Excl./Incl.
ExclIncl.description:
Exclusion/Inclusion indicator for declara. to authorities  
Using this indicator, you can control if a document or a document item (SD billing document, MM purchase order) will be excluded from or included in one or more types of declarations to the authorities.  
Proceed as follows:  
Define the inclusion or exclusion indicator. Define for which declaration type an inclusion or exclusion is to take place.  
Assign the indicator to the document or document item that you want to include in or exclude from a declaration. The assignment takes place in the Foreign Trade data of the document.  
If you also want to exclude document items with particular item types from a declaration, assign an exclusion indicator to the corresponding item types in Customizing.  
You want to define an exclusion indicator that excludes documents from the EXTRASTAT and KOBRA declaration. Create an exclusion indicator and select the "exclusion column" in the definition of exclusion indicators for the EXTRASTAT and KOBRA declaration types.  
As soon as this indicator is assigned to a document, this document will not be included in the EXTRASTAT and KOBRA declarations.  
Inclusion or exclusion indicators assigned at FT data header level in the document apply to all document items if there is no other indicator at item level.

Currency2.title: Currency
Currency2.description: Currency of customs values for import procg in foreign trade

Invoicenumber.title: Invoice number
Invoicenumber.description:
Invoice: Number of invoice document for import processing  
The invoice number is an external number which is published when the goods arrive. Usually, it is a pro forma billing document.  
This number is communicated to the relevant authorities for the customs declaration.

InvoiceDateofinvoicedocumentforimportpro.title: Invoice: Date of invoice document for import processing

PrevDocType.title: PrevDocType
PrevDocType.description:
Preliminary document: Document type for foreign trade procg  
The document type uniquely identifies the document that has been assigned to the relevant transaction. The SAP system differentiates between export declarations, T documents (export) and preliminary documents (import).  
Export-relevant papers include:  
Export declaration (for example, EX1 final export to third country)  
T documents        (for example, T1 shipping papers)  
Import-relevant documents include:  
Preliminary documents (for example, T1 shipping papers)

PreliminarydocumentDateofpreliminarydocf.title: Preliminary document: Date of preliminary doc.f.import procg

Preldocno.title: Prel.doc. no.
Preldocno.description:
Preliminary document: No. of preliminary doc.f.import procg  
The preliminary document number identifies the preliminary documents for the import procedure.  
In Europe, the preliminary document 'T1' is required for importing goods from a third country and opening an import procedure.

Issauthority7.title: Iss.authority
Issauthority7.description:
Preliminary doc.: Issuing authority of relevant prelim.doc.  
This field is used for customs declarations supported by EDIFACT, for example EDV/ZOLL in Austria or ATLAS in Germany.  
If you open a T1 procedure in Europe, you have to specify the competent authority at the EU border.

CustoffIDno.title: Cust.off./ID no
CustoffIDno.description:
Preliminary document: Customs office/ID number for import  
This number identifies the customs office which opens the customs procedure and issues the preliminary document.

ISOcode8.title: ISO code
ISOcode8.description:
Prelim. doc.: ISO code of ctry issuing the preliminary doc.  
When you import or export goods, you need this specification for the electronic customs declaration. Enter here the ISO code of the country for the preliminary document.  
The ISO code is used as a country key during the exchange of information.  
Enter the ISO code for each country. This is particularly important when you exchange information via EDI.

Preferencecode.title: Preference code
Preferencecode.description:
Preference code for foreign trade (decl.to author., import)  
As from reporting period January 1997 preference should be declared according to customs law when importing from third countries (based on article 10, section 1, letter h) of the EU decree no. 1172/95 from the Council, 22 May 1995).  
Preference is the word used to describe preferential duty terms, the prerequisites for which are fulfilled at the time of submitting a customs declaration. Please use a three digit numerical code for declaring the preference.  
Examples of the most frequently used preference codes:  
 100  Application of third country customs record  
 120  GATT product allocation according to footnotes in customs tariff  
 200  Application of APS customs record without extra requirements  
 300  Application of affected customs record with preference without  
      any further restrictions  
If no preferential duty terms have been submitted, then enter code '100'.

Preferencetype.title: Preference type
Preferencetype.description:
Preference: Preference type for foreign trade  
If you declare goods as relevant for preference, you have to specify the type of the preference verification.  
In Europe, for example, you have to specify EUR.1 or the declaration of origin for goods imported from EFTA countries into the European Union. Future automated systems, such as ATLAS in Germany or EDV/ZOLL in Austria, use their own codes. You can find them in the relevant code list.

Prefdocno3.title: Pref.doc. no.
Prefdocno3.description:
Preference: Official number of preference document - Import  
This number is required for electronic exchange between the business party and the customs authorities, for example, EDV/ZOLL in Austria or ATLAS in Germany.  
This number specifies that the goods have been imported with a valid preference document.  
Importing goods from Switzerland into the European Union:  
If goods are imported with a EUR1 document, these goods are accepted customs-free for free movement within the EU.  
Importing goods from India into the European Union:  
If goods are imported with a FORM_A document (document from the general system of preferences (GSP)), a reduced tariff rate is levied as soon as the goods are accepted for free movement within the EU.

PreferenceDateofpreferencedocumentforimp.title: Preference: Date of preference document for import procg

ISOcode9.title: ISO code
ISOcode9.description:
Preference: ISO code of country issuing the preference doc.  
When importing or exporting goods, you need to make this specification for the electronic customs declaration. Enter the ISO code of the country of the preference document here.  
When data is exchanged via EDI, the ISO code is used as a country key.  
Enter the ISO code for each country. This is particularly important when you exchange information using EDI.

Issauthority41.title: Iss.authority
Issauthority41.description:
Preference: Issuing authoritiy for relevant preference doc.  
This field is used for EDIFACT-supported customs declarations, for example, EDV/ZOLL in Austria and ATLAS in Germany.  
If a T1 procedure is opened in Europe, the relevant authorities have to be specified at the EU border.

PreferenceValiditydateofpreferencedocume.title: Preference: Validity date of preference document for import

Veriftype.title: Verif.type
Veriftype.description:
Verification documents: Type of certificate for import  
Key of the relevant certificate.  
Example from CUSDEC-ATLAS (Germany) - see CUSDEC 2.9.7.1 Type of certificate, 2.9 for foreign trade data:  
Type of certificate  
01   Certificate of origin  
02   Declaration of origin  
03   Other documentary evidence of origin  
04   Coffee certificate or import acknowledgement  
05   Handicraft certificate  
07   Certificate of origin for agricultural products  
Import Procedure Documents / Exemptions  
EA  
EG   Import authorization  
EE   Import declaration  
EH  
EL   Import license  
VB  
IC  
Example from CUSDEC-EDV/ZOLL (Austria):  
See EDV/Zoll documentation ZK-0620

Verificatno.title: Verificat. no.
Verificatno.description:
Verification docs: Official no. of verific. doc. - Import  
This number is required for electronics data exchange between the partners involved in a business transaction and the customs authorities, for example, EDV/ZOLL in Austria or ATLAS in Germany.  
This number means that the imported goods have been imported with a valid verification document.

VerificationdocumentsDateofverifdocforim.title: Verification documents: Date of verif.doc. for import procg

ISOcode10.title: ISO code
ISOcode10.description:
Verification doc: ISO code of ctry supplying verific.doc.  
When you import or export goods, you need to make this entry for the electronic customs declaration. Enter here the ISO code that the country uses for the verification document.  
When data is exchanged via EDI, the ISO code is used as country key.  
Enter the ISO code for each country. This is particularly important when you exchange information using EDI.

Issauthority42.title: Iss.authority
Issauthority42.description:
Verification documents: Issuing authority for relev. verif.  
This field is used for customs declarations supported by EDIFACT, for example EDV/Zoll in Austria and ATLAS in Germany.  
If a T1 procedure is opened in Europe, the relevant authorities must be specified at the border of the European Union.

VerificationdocsValiditydateofverificdoc.title: Verification docs: Validity date of verific.doc. for import

Description4.title: Description
Description4.description:
Comments: Text for foreign trade processing  
Text field for foreign trade processing.

Description5.title: Description
Description5.description:
Comments: Text for foreign trade processing  
Text field for foreign trade processing.

Description6.title: Description
Description6.description:
Comments: Text for foreign trade processing  
Text field for foreign trade processing.

Exportdocument.title: Export document
Exportdocument.description: Export document: Export document type for foreign trade

Expdecl.title: Exp.decl.
Expdecl.description:
Export document: Official number of export document  
This number is required for electronics data exchange between the partners involved in a business transaction and the customs authorities, for example, EDV/ZOLL in Austria or ATLAS in Germany.  
This number means that the imported goods have been imported with a valid verification document.

ExportDeclValidTo.title: ExportDecl.ValidTo
ExportDeclValidTo.description: Export document: Valid-to number of export document

Tdoctype.title: T doc. type
Tdoctype.description: T document: Type of T document for foreign trade

Tdocumentno.title: T document no.
Tdocumentno.description:
T document: Official number of T document for foreign trade  
This number is required for electronics data exchange between the partners involved in a business transaction and the customs authorities, for example, EDV/ZOLL in Austria or ATLAS in Germany.  
This number means that the imported goods have been imported with a valid verification document.

TdocNextPage.title: T doc.-NextPage
TdocNextPage.description:
T doc.: Official no. for next page of T doc. f.foreign trade  
This number is required for electronics data exchange between the partners involved in a business transaction and the customs authorities, for example, EDV/ZOLL in Austria or ATLAS in Germany.  
This number means that the imported goods have been imported with a valid verification document.

Preftype.title: Pref.type
Preftype.description: Preference: Preference type for foreign trade

Prefdocno4.title: Pref.doc. no.
Prefdocno4.description:
Preference: Official number of preference document - Export  
This number is required for electronic data exchange between the partners involved in a business transaction and the customs authorities, for example, EDV/ZOLL in Austria or ATLAS in Germany.  
This number means that the goods have been imported with a valid preference document.  
Importing goods from Switzerland into the European Community:  
If goods are imported with a EUR1 document, no customs duty will be levied.  
Importing goods from India into the European Community:  
If goods are imported with a FORM_A document (document from the General System of Preferences (GPS) ), the customs authorities levy a reduced customs duty as soon as these goods have been imported into the European Community.

T5documentno.title: T5 document no.
T5documentno.description:
CAP: Official number of T5 document for foreign trade  
This number is required for electronics data exchange between the partners involved in a business transaction and the customs authorities, for example, EDV/ZOLL in Austria or ATLAS in Germany.  
This number means that the imported goods have been imported with a valid verification document.

Placeofload.title: Place of load.
Placeofload.description:
Place of loading/unloading for foreign trade  
You can use this field both for import and export. It determines the location where the means of transport loads or unloads the goods.  
In Europe, this field is only filled for dispatch/export via sea transport. You must specify the location where the goods are loaded onto the means of transport which is used for crossing the border of the European Community. (Instruction sheet for the Single Administrative Document, Field 27)

Exporter.title: Exporter
Exporter.description:
Exporter for import processing in foreign trade  
In order to determine a suitable anti-dumping code, you may be required to specify the exporter, depending on the legal regulations.

Complete.title: Complete
Complete.description:
Status: Complete document data in foreign trade (user)  
Using this indicator, you can report foreign trade activities as correct and completed.  
You set this indicator manually and you can evaluate it with a monitoring or evaluation report.

Correctdata.title: Correct data
Correctdata.description:
Status: Document data in foreign trade complete (system)  
The person responsible for the area of foreign trade, both for import and export, can use this indicator to confirm that the system specifications regarding foreign trade and foreign trade law are correct.  
You can use the monitoring program to list the incomplete documents (import purchase orders, export billing documents).

Cusoffctry1.title: Cus.off.ctry
Cusoffctry1.description:
Customs office: Country of customs office for foreign trade  
Country in which the relevant customs office is located.

Cusoffctry2.title: Cus.off.ctry
Cusoffctry2.description:
Customs office: Country of customs office for foreign trade  
Country in which the relevant customs office is located.

Cusoffctry3.title: Cus.off.ctry
Cusoffctry3.description:
Customs office: Country of customs office for foreign trade  
Country in which the relevant customs office is located.

Cusoffctry4.title: Cus.off.ctry
Cusoffctry4.description:
Customs office: Country of customs office for foreign trade  
Country in which the relevant customs office is located.

Cusoffctry5.title: Cus.off.ctry
Cusoffctry5.description:
Customs office: Country of customs office for foreign trade  
Country in which the relevant customs office is located.

Cusoffctry6.title: Cus.off.ctry
Cusoffctry6.description:
Customs office: Country of customs office for foreign trade  
Country in which the relevant customs office is located.

ExpCusOffice.title: ExpCusOffice
ExpCusOffice.description:
Customs office: Export customs office for foreign trade  
Specifies the code of the customs office through which the goods leave or enter the country.  
This information is used for setting up export/import data for foreign trade statistics.  
The code to be entered depends on your location. Examples:  
Within the European Union (EU), you enter the code of the domestic port or airport at which the goods cross the border and are loaded onto or unloaded from the active means of transport.  
In the United States, you enter the code which has been assigned to the relevant US export port in the Schedule D Directory.

FTBasDocCat.title: FT BasDocCat.
FTBasDocCat.description: Basis document category for foreign trade processing

SalesDocument.title: Sales Document
SalesDocument.description:
Sales and Distribution Document Number  
The number that uniquely identifies the sales, delivery, or billing document.

MoTransptype.title: MoTransp. type
MoTransptype.description: Foreign Trade: Type of means of transport

Custdecltype.title: Cust.decl.type
Custdecltype.description: Customs declaration type for customs processing in FT

Client.title: Client
Client.description: A legally and organizationally independent unit which uses the system.

Fortrdatano.title: For.tr.data no.
Fortrdatano.description:
Number of foreign trade data in MM and SD documents  
Internal number for export data.

Item.title: Item
Item.description:
Internal item number for foreign trade data in MM and SD  
Internal item number for export data.

Commimpcode.title: Comm./imp. code
Commimpcode.description:
Commodity Code/Import Code Number for Foreign Trade  
Official key corresponding to the harmonized system for the description and coding of merchandise.  
Depending on the system settings, this field contains either the commodity code or the customs tariff number (import code number).  
The commodity code is used for statistical purposes and must be declared to the authorities for various foreign trade transactions, both import and export transactions. Examples include INTRASTAT and EXTRASTAT declarations in the European Union or the Automated Export System (AES) in the USA.  
The customs tariff number classifies goods according to the harmonized system for the description and coding of merchandise and serves to determine customs duties. You must declare this number to the customs authorities for every import transaction.

Procedure.title: Procedure
Procedure.description:
Export/Import Procedure for Foreign Trade  
Specifies a standard, 5-digit code that uniquely identifies an export/import procedure.  
For business transactions within the European Community (EC), the export/import procedure code is part of the information that you submit in monthly reports to Intrastat and is of statistical interest only. Intrastat uses this information to produce foreign trade statistics.  
During export sales processing, for example, the system may automatically propose an export/import procedure code, based on the following criteria:  
Country from which goods are exported or into which goods are being imported  
Sales area  
Export/import material group  
Item category of individual goods  
You can overwrite the proposed value manually in the delivery and in the billing document.  
The export/import procedure code can distinguish, for example, between the following export/import transactions:  
Goods that are shipped temporarily for further manufacture by a subcontractor  
Goods that are shipped to their final destination after processing by a subcontractor

BusTransactType.title: BusTransactType
BusTransactType.description:
Business Transaction Type for Foreign Trade  
Classifies the type of business transaction which is performed.  
Within the European Union (EU), this information is required for the reporting of import and export data to Intrastat. See Intrastat declaration.  
In addition, the business transaction type is used by the system during export control. When an export license is assigned to an item in a sales document, the business transaction type of the item must match that of the export license.  
During license master maintenance, the system uses the country for the company code as the country key for determining the allowed values for the business transaction type.  
The classifications can be different for goods sold in the usual way, those exported for subcontracting, and those sent as free of charge samples.

Ctryoforigin.title: Ctry of origin
Ctryoforigin.description:
Country of Origin of Material (Non-Preferential Origin)  
Key of the country in which the material has been produced.  
You are legally required to specify the country of origin both for export and import.  
Export  
You prove the origin of a material by presenting the certificate of origin. This is issued and controlled by the relevant authority of the issuing country.  
This authority confirms the origin of a material and the required information with the certificate of origin.  
Import  
The relevant authority of the importing country - usually the Ministry of Economic Affairs - stipulates which regulations regarding customs and foreign trade law have to be observed for the certificates of origin accompanying goods.  
This information is used for foreign trade processing in different areas, such as:  
Foreign trade law  
Customs law  
Example for Europe:  
Article 9 of the EU origin regulation is the legal regulation for the certificate of origin.  
The responsible authorities in Germany include:  
Chamber of Commerce (Industrie- und Handelskammer)  
Chamber of Handicrafts (Handwerkskammer)  
Customs office

Regoforigin.title: Reg. of origin
Regoforigin.description:
Region of Origin of Material (Non-Preferential Origin)  
Describes more precisely the origin of goods.  
You can enter a region of the country from which the goods originate.  
This information is required for the declarations regarding goods dispatches/imports and goods receipts/exports which are made to the authorities. Declarations to the authorities for foreign trade are a legal requirement in many countries.  
INTRASTAT - Declaration in the European Union  
EXTRASTAT - Declaration in the European Union  
In the materials management document, the 'region of destination' field indicates the region of the receiving plant.

Statistvalue.title: Statist.value
Statistvalue.description:
Statistical value for foreign trade  
Specifies the statistical value of goods when they cross the border during export/import transactions.  
In the European Union (EU), the statistical value is required for each exported/imported item when you submit monthly INTRASTAT declarations. INTRASTAT uses this information to create foreign trade statistics.  
The statistical value is also used for customs declarations and has to be printed on export documents.  
These export document include, for example:  
Export declaration (EX)  
Refund on exports  
Export/Import processing can then take place on the basis of the statistical value.  
The system determines statistical values on the basis of condition records with condition types GRWR and GWLB (subcontracting).  
In Sales and Distribution, the condition records are created for each relevant Incoterm within a sales area. In Materials Management, the condition records are created for each Incoterm within a plant or purchasing organization.  
You export an order to a customer in another European Union member state. You cover the transportation and insurance costs.  
In this case, the statistical value must represent the costs from the border to the customer minus the transportation and insurance costs. The statistical value in the order is specified as a percentage (for example, 70%) of the amount that is billed before VAT.  
The difference (in this case, 30%) represents the estimated transportation and insurance costs from the border to the customer.  
You import goods from a vendor from another European Union member state. You cover the transportation and insurance costs.  
In this case, the statistical value must represent the costs from the vendor to the border minus the transportation and insurance costs. The statistical value in the purchase order is specified as a percentage (for example, 80%) of the purchase order value before VAT.  
The difference (in this case, 20%) represents the estimated transportation and insurance costs from the vendor to the border.  
The system automatically determines the statistical value in the billing document. You can change the value manually in the invoice.  
The system automatically determines the statistical value in the purchase order. You can change the value manually in the purchase order.

Preferencecode.title: Preference code
Preferencecode.description:
Preference code for foreign trade (decl.to author., import)  
As from reporting period January 1997 preference should be declared according to customs law when importing from third countries (based on article 10, section 1, letter h) of the EU decree no. 1172/95 from the Council, 22 May 1995).  
Preference is the word used to describe preferential duty terms, the prerequisites for which are fulfilled at the time of submitting a customs declaration. Please use a three digit numerical code for declaring the preference.  
Examples of the most frequently used preference codes:  
 100  Application of third country customs record  
 120  GATT product allocation according to footnotes in customs tariff  
 200  Application of APS customs record without extra requirements  
 300  Application of affected customs record with preference without  
      any further restrictions  
If no preferential duty terms have been submitted, then enter code '100'.

ExclIncl.title: Excl./Incl.
ExclIncl.description:
Exclusion/Inclusion indicator for declara. to authorities  
Using this indicator, you can control if a document or a document item (SD billing document, MM purchase order) will be excluded from or included in one or more types of declarations to the authorities.  
Proceed as follows:  
Define the inclusion or exclusion indicator. Define for which declaration type an inclusion or exclusion is to take place.  
Assign the indicator to the document or document item that you want to include in or exclude from a declaration. The assignment takes place in the Foreign Trade data of the document.  
If you also want to exclude document items with particular item types from a declaration, assign an exclusion indicator to the corresponding item types in Customizing.  
You want to define an exclusion indicator that excludes documents from the EXTRASTAT and KOBRA declaration. Create an exclusion indicator and select the "exclusion column" in the definition of exclusion indicators for the EXTRASTAT and KOBRA declaration types.  
As soon as this indicator is assigned to a document, this document will not be included in the EXTRASTAT and KOBRA declarations.  
Inclusion or exclusion indicators assigned at FT data header level in the document apply to all document items if there is no other indicator at item level.

EUprodlistno.title: EU prod.list no.
EUprodlistno.description:
CAP: Number of CAP products list  
This field contains the number of the material in the EU market products group list.

CAPprodgroup.title: CAP prod. group
CAPprodgroup.description:
Common Agricultural Policy: CAP products group-Foreign Trade  
Using the EU market products group, you can combine goods that are relevant for the EU market and for which the same conditions apply within the EU market.

PRODCOMno.title: PRODCOM no.
PRODCOMno.description:
Production statistics: PRODCOM number for foreign trade  
Alphanumeric key which allows a systematic categorization of goods for production statistics.  
In order to harmonize the production statistics in the EU member states, the Council of Ministers of the European Communities drew up EEC regulation No. 3429/91 on December 19, 1991. This regulation introduced a Community survey on the production of goods (EC No. L 374 of December 1991) and represents a legal basis which specifies the procedure to be used as well as the nomenclature of goods.  
The PRODCOM (PRODuction COMmunautaire) list items have been defined and classified according to the Harmonized System for describing and coding goods (HS) and the Combined Nomenclature for foreign trade.  
This allows a direct comparison of production and foreign trade statistics.

CASnopharm.title: CAS no.(pharm.)
CASnopharm.description:
CAS number for pharmaceutical products in foreign trade  
Key from the list of descriptions given by the World Health Organization (WHO) for customs-free pharmaceutical materials.  
Customs exemption applies for the following categories of pharmaceutical products:  
Pharmaceutical products  
Salt, ester, hydrate  
Products for manufacturing pharmaceutical materials  
The electronic customs tariff (Europe) displays additional codes for these pharmaceutical materials:  
2500 - Customs-free pharmaceutical materials  
2501 - All other goods

Dispatchctry.title: Dispatch ctry
Dispatchctry.description:
Country of dispatch for Foreign Trade  
The country of dispatch is the country from which the goods are sent or exported. This field differs from the 'country of origin' field in those cases in which the goods are processed in third countries (for example, inward or outward processing) or involved in other legal transactions before they enter the importing country.

Tradingcountry.title: Trading country
Tradingcountry.description:
Trading country for foreign trade  
When you import goods, you have to specify the selling country - the country in which the responsible person is resident - as the trading country.

Description1.title: Description
Description1.description:
Comments: Text for foreign trade processing  
Text field for foreign trade processing.

Description2.title: Description
