Comments: Text for foreign trade processing  
Text field for foreign trade processing.

Description3.title: Description
Description3.description:
Comments: Text for foreign trade processing  
Text field for foreign trade processing.

Customsquota.title: Customs quota
Customsquota.description:
Customs quota code for import processing in foreign trade  
Customs quotas are based on special legal requirements and represent reduced customs duty rates which are granted within a specific period of time. A customs quota ends when a specific import volume has been reached. Afterwards, the regular customs duty is valid.  
The following applies to Europe: The quota quantity is valid for the whole European Community. The quotas are managed by the Commission of the European Communities.  
 Seq. no.        Additinal specific.     Exhausted on    Code numbers (add. code)  
______________________________________________________________________  
  121            100t, from Jan. 1 1990                  080920102910  
 (0901)          until Dec. 31 1990                      080920902250  
                                                         ...

Pharmaceuprod.title: Pharmaceu.prod.
Pharmaceuprod.description:
Pharmaceutical products code (Foreign Trade)  
The pharmaceutical products code assigns the status "exempt from customs duties" or "not exempt from customs duties" to certain pharmaceutical substances.  
Apart from the anti-dumping code and the customs quota code, this is one of the three additional codes which control certain customs measures.

Antidumping.title: Antidumping
Antidumping.description:
Anti-dumping code for import processing in foreign trade  
Additional code that has to be specified for an anti-dumping method if customs duties refer to goods that are produced and/or exported by specific companies.  
The anti-dumping customs duty is a protective duty that serves to prevent subsidies and dumping, that is, selling goods abroad at a lower price than the sales price of the same goods under the same conditions within the country.

Invoicenumber.title: Invoice number
Invoicenumber.description:
Invoice: Number of invoice document for import processing  
The invoice number is an external number which is published when the goods arrive. Usually, it is a pro forma billing document.  
This number is communicated to the relevant authorities for the customs declaration.

InvoiceDateofinvoicedocumentforimportpro.title: Invoice: Date of invoice document for import processing

PrevDocType.title: PrevDocType
PrevDocType.description:
Preliminary document: Document type for foreign trade procg  
The document type uniquely identifies the document that has been assigned to the relevant transaction. The SAP system differentiates between export declarations, T documents (export) and preliminary documents (import).  
Export-relevant papers include:  
Export declaration (for example, EX1 final export to third country)  
T documents        (for example, T1 shipping papers)  
Import-relevant documents include:  
Preliminary documents (for example, T1 shipping papers)

Preldocno.title: Prel.doc. no.
Preldocno.description:
Preliminary document: No. of preliminary doc.f.import procg  
The preliminary document number identifies the preliminary documents for the import procedure.  
In Europe, the preliminary document 'T1' is required for importing goods from a third country and opening an import procedure.

PreliminarydocumentDateofpreliminarydocf.title: Preliminary document: Date of preliminary doc.f.import procg

Issauthority1.title: Iss.authority
Issauthority1.description:
Preliminary doc.: Issuing authority of relevant prelim.doc.  
This field is used for customs declarations supported by EDIFACT, for example EDV/ZOLL in Austria or ATLAS in Germany.  
If you open a T1 procedure in Europe, you have to specify the competent authority at the EU border.

CustoffIDno.title: Cust.off./ID no
CustoffIDno.description:
Preliminary document: Customs office/ID number for import  
This number identifies the customs office which opens the customs procedure and issues the preliminary document.

ISOcode1.title: ISO code
ISOcode1.description:
Prelim. doc.: ISO code of ctry issuing the preliminary doc.  
When you import or export goods, you need this specification for the electronic customs declaration. Enter here the ISO code of the country for the preliminary document.  
The ISO code is used as a country key during the exchange of information.  
Enter the ISO code for each country. This is particularly important when you exchange information via EDI.

Preferencetype.title: Preference type
Preferencetype.description:
Preference: Preference type for foreign trade  
If you declare goods as relevant for preference, you have to specify the type of the preference verification.  
In Europe, for example, you have to specify EUR.1 or the declaration of origin for goods imported from EFTA countries into the European Union. Future automated systems, such as ATLAS in Germany or EDV/ZOLL in Austria, use their own codes. You can find them in the relevant code list.

Prefdocno1.title: Pref.doc. no.
Prefdocno1.description:
Preference: Official number of preference document - Import  
This number is required for electronic exchange between the business party and the customs authorities, for example, EDV/ZOLL in Austria or ATLAS in Germany.  
This number specifies that the goods have been imported with a valid preference document.  
Importing goods from Switzerland into the European Union:  
If goods are imported with a EUR1 document, these goods are accepted customs-free for free movement within the EU.  
Importing goods from India into the European Union:  
If goods are imported with a FORM_A document (document from the general system of preferences (GSP)), a reduced tariff rate is levied as soon as the goods are accepted for free movement within the EU.

PreferenceDateofpreferencedocumentforimp.title: Preference: Date of preference document for import procg

ISOcode2.title: ISO code
ISOcode2.description:
Preference: ISO code of country issuing the preference doc.  
When importing or exporting goods, you need to make this specification for the electronic customs declaration. Enter the ISO code of the country of the preference document here.  
When data is exchanged via EDI, the ISO code is used as a country key.  
Enter the ISO code for each country. This is particularly important when you exchange information using EDI.

Issauthority2.title: Iss.authority
Issauthority2.description:
Preference: Issuing authoritiy for relevant preference doc.  
This field is used for EDIFACT-supported customs declarations, for example, EDV/ZOLL in Austria and ATLAS in Germany.  
If a T1 procedure is opened in Europe, the relevant authorities have to be specified at the EU border.

PreferenceValiditydateofpreferencedocume.title: Preference: Validity date of preference document for import

ExportDeclValidTo.description: Export document: Valid-to number of export document

Tdoctype.description: T document: Type of T document for foreign trade

Tdocumentno.description:
T document: Official number of T document for foreign trade  
This number is required for electronics data exchange between the partners involved in a business transaction and the customs authorities, for example, EDV/ZOLL in Austria or ATLAS in Germany.  
This number means that the imported goods have been imported with a valid verification document.

TdocNextPage.description:
T doc.: Official no. for next page of T doc. f.foreign trade  
This number is required for electronics data exchange between the partners involved in a business transaction and the customs authorities, for example, EDV/ZOLL in Austria or ATLAS in Germany.

Preftype.title: Pref.type
Preftype.description: Preference: Preference type for foreign trade

Prefdocno2.title: Pref.doc. no.
Prefdocno2.description:
Preference: Official number of preference document - Export  
This number is required for electronic data exchange between the partners involved in a business transaction and the customs authorities, for example, EDV/ZOLL in Austria or ATLAS in Germany.  
This number means that the goods have been imported with a valid preference document.  
Importing goods from Switzerland into the European Community:  
If goods are imported with a EUR1 document, no customs duty will be levied.  
Importing goods from India into the European Community:  
If goods are imported with a FORM_A document (document from the General System of Preferences (GPS) ), the customs authorities levy a reduced customs duty as soon as these goods have been imported into the European Community.

T5documentno.description:
CAP: Official number of T5 document for foreign trade  
This number is required for electronics data exchange between the partners involved in a business transaction and the customs authorities, for example, EDV/ZOLL in Austria or ATLAS in Germany.  
This number means that the imported goods have been imported with a valid verification document.

Correctdata.title: Correct data
Correctdata.description:
Status: Document data in foreign trade complete (system)  
The person responsible for the area of foreign trade, both for import and export, can use this indicator to confirm that the system specifications regarding foreign trade and foreign trade law are correct.  
You can use the monitoring program to list the incomplete documents (import purchase orders, export billing documents).

Importcodeno.title: Import code no.
Importcodeno.description:
Code number for import processing in foreign trade  
This code number is only used for importing goods. The length of the code number (that is, the customs code number) depends on the country or state group. The first six digits of this number are the same worldwide.  
European Union  
In the European Union, this number always has 11 digits. You can extend the code number by national codes. In the SAP system, the additional codes anti-dumping, customs quota, pharmaceutical products, and consumption tax are specified separately and can be determined automatically.  
The first eight digits of the code number and the commodity code are the same.  
Japan  
In Japan, the code number has 10 digits.  
The code number and the commodity code have the same length but can have different structures.  
You can distinguish between the code number for import - Yunyutokeihinmokubango - from the Customs Tariff Schedule Japan and the commodity code - Yushutsutokeihinmokubango - from the Export Statistical Schedule. In this case, you can select the import code number by using the load program of the relevant diskette. This means that only these selected code numbers will be copied into the code number field in the import purchase order. Otherwise, the commodity code is copied into the import purchase order, both into the commodity code field and the code number field.  
You must make this conversion by using table T604U and "From country = To Country".  
USA  
In the USA, the code number also has 10 digits.  
The commodity code (Harmonized System (HS) - Schedule B) has ten digits  
and can deviate from the code number (customs code number).

Manufactno.title: Manufact. no.
Manufactno.description:
Manufacturer number for import processing in foreign trade  
In order to determine the relevant anti-dumping code, you may have to specify the manufacturer, depending on the legal regulation.

CodeDestinCtry.title: Code DestinCtry
CodeDestinCtry.description:
Import code no. in destination country for foreign trade  
This code number is only used for importing goods. The length of this code number (that is, the customs code number) depends on the country or state group. The first six digits of this number are the same worldwide.  
European Union  
In the European Union, this number always has eleven digits. You can extend the code number by national codes. In the SAP system, the additional codes anti-dumping, customs quota, pharmaceutical products, and consumption tax are specified separately and can be determined automatically.  
The first eight digits of the code number and the commodity code are the same.  
Japan  
In Japan, the code number has ten digits.  
The code number and the commodity code have the same length but can have different structures.  
You can distinguish between the code number for import - Yunyutokeihinmokubango - from the Customs Tariff Schedule Japan and the commodity code - Yushutsutokeihinmokubango - from the Export Statistical Schedule. In this case, you can select the import code number by using the load program of the relevant diskette.  
This means that only these selected code numbers will be copied into the code number field in the import purchase order. Otherwise, the commodity code is copied into the import purchase order, both into the commodity code field and the code number field.  
You must make this conversion by using table T604U and "From country = To Country".  
USA  
In the USA, the code number also has ten digits.  
The commodity code (Harmonized System (HS) - Schedule B) has ten digits and can deviate from the code number (customscode number).

Complete.title: Complete
Complete.description:
Status: Complete document data in foreign trade (user)  
Using this indicator, you can report foreign trade activities as correct and completed.  
You set this indicator manually and you can evaluate it with a monitoring or evaluation report.

EDIcustoms.title: EDI customs
EDIcustoms.description:
EDI: Export/Import customs tariff number for foreign trade  
With this indicator, foreign trade activities are flagged which the customs authorities transmit via EDIFACT.  
AES (Automated Export System) in the USA, ATLAS procedure in Germany or EDV/Zoll in Austria.

CudecllistNo.title: Cu.decl.list-No
CudecllistNo.description:
Foreign Trade:Customs declaration list no. for Foreign Trade  
The customs office issues the customs declaration list number when goods are declared.  
The number has to be specified in various documents.

Regno.title: Reg.no.
Regno.description:
Registration number for import processing in foreign trade  
The registration number is a sequential number issued by the customs office. For example, in the German ATLAS procedure, this number and the approval from the customs authorities is transmitted to the relevant person. In this case, the number is structured as follows:  
   Administrative office         n4  
   No. of customs office         n1  
   Year                          n4  
   Declaration category          an1 (for example, 'E' for EZA)  
   Document range indicator      an2  
   Sequential number             n..7

Exemptioncert.title: Exemption cert.
Exemptioncert.description:
Exemption certificate: Indicator for legal control  
Set the indicator A if a certificate has been applied for which stipulates that the material does not require a license for import or export.  
Set the indicator B if a certificate exists which stipulates that the material does not require a license for import or export. In addition, enter the number and issuing date of the certificate in the respective fields.  
Set the indicator C if the application for a certificate has been rejected for this material.  
Leave the field blank if the material requires an import or export license.  
During export control, if the indicator B has been set and the date of issue and number of the certificate have been entered, the system determines that the material does not require an export license.

Exemptcertno.title: Exempt.cert.no.
Exemptcertno.description:
Exemption certificate number for legal control  
Enter the number assigned by the authorities for the exemption certificate.

ExemptioncertificateIssuedateofexemption.title: Exemption certificate: Issue date of exemption certificate

Ceilingnumber1.title: Ceiling number
Ceilingnumber1.description: Quota or Ceiling Number for Import Processing

Ceilingnumber2.title: Ceiling number
Ceilingnumber2.description: Quota or Ceiling Number for Import Processing

Itemtype.title: Item type
Itemtype.description:
A way of classifying items that require different kinds of processing by the system.  
The system processes items that refer to a specific material differently than items that do not refer to a material. For example, text items do not require processing for pricing, taxes, and weight calculations.

ItemCategory.title: Item Category
ItemCategory.description:
Sales Document Item Category  
A classification that distinguishes between different types of item (for example, free of charge items and text items) and determines how the system processes the item.  
The system proposes an item category. If alternatives are defined for your system, you can change the item category manually in the sales document.  
If, for example, you identify an item as a free or charge item, you tell the system, in this case, to ignore normal pricing procedures.

Client.title: Client
Client.description: A legally and organizationally independent unit which uses the system.

InternalHUno.title: Internal HU no.
InternalHUno.description:
Internal Handling Unit Number  
Uniquely identifies a handling unit within a client. A handling unit is combination of materials and lower-level handling units that are packed together at one time in a packaging material (box or pallet, for example).  
There can be several items in one handling unit. The following information is recorded in these items:  
What auxiliary packaging materials are also included in packing  
What materials the item contains  
(including stock information, if the handling unit is at an HU-managed storage location)  
Which delivery item is used as a reference if the handling unit is assigned to a delivery, and which lower-level handling units are packed in this handling unit (if one handling unit is nested in another).

HandlingUnit.title: Handling Unit
HandlingUnit.description:
External Handling Unit Identification  
Specifies an external identifier for the handling unit.  
The system automatically generates an internal number that must be unique for each system client. The system also needs external identification so that it can uniquely identify handling units.  
Creating a handling unit:  
Identifiers for handling units are determined during creation according to settings in Customizing for number assignment of the packaging material type for the packaging material that is being used. You can also assign default values for identifiers when you create handling units, although these values must correspond to the settings in Customizing.  
Processing a handling unit  
To edit existing handling units, enter the handling unit's identification in this field.

IDType.title: ID Type
IDType.description:
Type of External Handling Unit Identifier  
Indicates how the external handling unit identifier is determined.  
If automatic assignment of a Serial Shipping Container Code (SSCC) is set in Customizing for the packaging material's packaging material type, the value is "C".

ShippingPoint.title: Shipping Point
ShippingPoint.description:
Shipping Point/Receiving Point  
The physical location (for example, a warehouse or collection of loading ramps) from which you ship the item.  
You can predefine shipping/receiving points in the system, based on different combinations of  
plants  
shipping conditions  
loading groups  
During delivery processing, the shipping/receiving point is the most important criterion that you use to select deliveries.  
A delivery can be shipped from one shipping point only or received at one receiving point only.  
If you want to provide more detailed information about a shipping point you can specify a loading point (for example, one of a number of different loading ramps).  
If, for example, you want to ship refrigerated goods to a certain customer by rail, the system proposes a shipping point with a suitable location and equipment for loading refrigerated goods onto rail cars.  
The system can propose a shipping/receiving point. If valid alternatives are predefined in your system, you can change the shipping/receiving point manually.  
You can define a user-specific default value for the shipping point in the user parameter VST.

LoadingPoint.title: Loading Point
LoadingPoint.description: The exact physical location where the loading of a delivery item takes place (for example, the number of a specific loading bay).

TotalWeight.title: Total Weight
TotalWeight.description:
Total Weight of Handling Unit  
Specifies the total weight of the handling unit.  
The total weight is calculated from the contents (the weight of the material items or the total weight of the lower-level handling units) plus the tare weight of the packaging material.

Loadingweight.title: Loading weight
Loadingweight.description:
Loading Weight of Handling Unit  
Specifies the total weight of the contents of a handling unit, excluding the tare weight of the handling unit (=packaging material).

Allowedweight.title: Allowed weight
Allowedweight.description:
Allowed Loading Weight of a Handling Unit  
Specifies the maximum loading weight that is allowed for this packaging material. The maximum weight of a handling unit is the sum of the tare weight and the maximum loading weight allowed, including excess weight tolerance.  
The system proposes the allowed loading weight from the material master. You can change the value manually in the handling unit.  
You can enter a tolerance limit for the maximum loading weight allowed for this packaging material.

Tareweight.title: Tare weight
Tareweight.description:
Tare weight of handling unit  
Specifies the unloaded weight of the handling unit.  
The system automatically proposes the gross weight of the packaging material from the material master record.  
The tare weight of a container would be the weight of the container itself (in other words, the total weight of the load minus the weight of the container's contents).

WeightUnit2.title: Weight Unit
WeightUnit2.description:
Unit referring to the gross weight or net weight of the material.  
If you specify a weight, you must enter the corresponding unit of weight here.

TotalVolume.title: Total Volume
TotalVolume.description:
Total Volume of Handling Unit  
Specifies the total volume of the handling unit.  
Determination of the total volume depends on the packaging material.  
For open packaging materials, such as pallets, total volume is calculated from the tare volume of the packaging (=packaging materials) and the volume of the contents.  
For closed packaging materials, such as boxes with lids, the total volume is equal to the tare volume of the packaging.  
An indicator specifies whether the packaging material in question is open or closed.

Loadingvolume.title: Loading volume
Loadingvolume.description:
Loading Volume of Handling Unit  
Specifies the total volume of the content of the handling unit. This volume is made up of the sum of the total volume of the lower-level handling units (if the handling unit contains other handling units) or the volume of the materials in the handling unit.  
The tare volume of the handling unit (=packaging material) is excluded.

Allowedvolume.title: Allowed volume
Allowedvolume.description:
Allowed Loading Volume for Handling Unit  
Specifies the maximum total loading-volume that is allowed for this packaging material.  
The maximum total volume of a handling unit is:  
The tare volume for closed packaging materials  
The sum of the tare volume and the maximum allowed loading volume for open packaging materials  
The system proposes the allowed loading volume from the material master. You can change the value manually in the handling unit.

Tarevolume.title: Tare volume
Tarevolume.description:
Tare volume of handling unit  
Specifies the unloaded volume of the handling unit.  
The system automatically proposes the volume of the packaging material, which is taken from the material master record.  
The tare volume of a container is the volume of the container itself.

VolumeUnit1.title: Volume Unit
VolumeUnit1.description:
Unit referring to the volume of the material.  
If you specify a volume, you have to enter the corresponding volume unit here.

Similar.title: Similar
Similar.description:
Number of Similar Packaging Materials  
Quantity of auxiliary packaging materials that the handling unit contains as additional packaging material.  
In the New HU per x HUs function, this field represents the number of similar handling units (similarity regarding packaging materials) that are to be packed.

CreatedBy.title: Created By
CreatedBy.description: Name of Person Who Created the Object

DateonWhichRecordWasCreated.title: Date on Which Record Was Created

Time.title: Time
Time.description:
Entry time  
The time of day at which the document was posted and stored in the system.

Changedby.title: Changed by
Changedby.description: Name of person who changed object

Searchterm.title: Search term
Searchterm.description:
Sort field  
Short name which is used to set up a matchcode.  
The significant part of the name should be entered in this field.  
For names like 'Mr. Eric P. Crawford', you should enter 'Crawford' in this field.

PackMaterials1.title: PackMaterials
PackMaterials1.description:
Packaging Materials  
Specifies the means of packing (box, wooden pallet, container) that can be used to pack and transport goods. Data for each packaging material you use is stored in a material master record.  
When you specify a packaging material for a handling unit, the system automatically proposes default data from the corresponding material master record (maximum allowed weight and volume, for example).

Length.title: Length
Length.description: Length of the material or its packaging, measured in the unit of dimension.

Width.title: Width
Width.description: Breadth of the material or its packaging, measured in the unit of dimension.

Height.title: Height
Height.description: Height of the material or its packaging, measured in the unit of dimension.

Unit.title: Unit
Unit.description:
Unit of Dimension for Length/Width/Height  
Unit in which the dimensions of length, breadth, and height of a material or its packaging are measured.

Status.title: Status
Status.description:
Status (at this time without functionality)  
The standard system does not use this indicator. You can freely define it to meet the requirements of your company.

Excesswttolerance.title: Excess wt tolerance
Excesswttolerance.description:
Excess Weight Tolerance for Handling unit  
Specifies the tolerance limit for exceeding the maximum weight allowed for a particular packaging material during packing.  
The tolerance limit is taken into consideration if you use the Pack material and New HU per part. qty of matrl functions for packing. The tolerance limit is not used in combination with the New HU if full function.

Excessvolumetol.title: Excess volume tol.
Excessvolumetol.description:
Excess Volume Tolerance of the Handling Unit  
Specifies the tolerance limit for the maximum packing volume allowed for a particular packaging material.  
The maximum packing volume allowed by the system is the maximum packing volume plus the tolerance for the following functions: Pack material, Pack HUs, New HU per part. qty of matrl. Tolerance is not included in the New HU if full function.

BaseUnit.title: Base Unit
BaseUnit.description:
Base Unit of Measure  
Unit of measure in which stocks of the material are managed. The system converts all the quantities you enter in other units of measure (alternative units of measure) to the base unit of measure.  
You define the base unit of measure and also alternative units of measure and their conversion factors in the material master record.  
Since all data is updated in the base unit of measure, your entry is particularly important for the conversion of alternative units of measure. A quantity in the alternative unit of measure can only be shown precisely if its value can be shown with the decimal places available. To ensure this, please note the following:  
The base unit of measure is the unit satisfying the highest necessary requirement for precision.  
The conversion of alternative units of measure to the base unit should result in simple decimal fractions (not, for example, 1/3 = 0.333...).  
Inventory Management  
In Inventory Management, the base unit of measure is the same as the stockkeeping unit.  
Services  
Services have units of measure of their own, including the following:  
Service unit  
Unit of measure at the higher item level. The precise quantities of the individual services are each at the detailed service line level.  
Blanket  
Unit of measure at service line level for services to be provided once only, and for which no precise quantities can or are to be specified.

VolumeUnit3.title: Volume Unit
VolumeUnit3.description:
Unit referring to the volume of the material.  
If you specify a volume, you have to enter the corresponding volume unit here.

WeightUnit4.title: Weight Unit
WeightUnit4.description:
Unit referring to the gross weight or net weight of the material.  
If you specify a weight, you must enter the corresponding unit of weight here.

Gendelivery.title: Gen.delivery
Gendelivery.description: Delivery in Which Packaging Material Is Generated as an Item

Packagmattype.title: Packag.mat.type
Packagmattype.description:
Packaging Material Type  
Enter a code and a description for a grouping of similar materials, such as crates, trucks or pallets.  
The packaging material type that you enter here is linked in Customizing to a material group for packaging materials, which you assign to a material in the material master. As you assemble the handling unit, you call up a list of packaging materials that are allowed for an item that you want to pack. This system puts together this list by matching the material group for packaging materials for that item with the appropriate packaging material types.  
Material group for packaging materials       Packaging material types  
0001 Beverages                               0010  Barrels  
0001 Beverages                               0020  Bottles  
0002 Small parts                             0030  Boxes  
0002 Small parts                             0040  Plastic bags  
0003 Pallets                                 0050  Containers  
0003 Pallets                                 0060  Trucks  
During packing, when you call up the list of allowed packaging materials for a material defined in the material master as material group 0001 (beverages), the system lists all packaging materials of type 0010 (barrels) and 0020 (bottles). For group 0002 (small parts), packaging materials assigned to types 0030 (boxes) and 0040 (plastic bags) would be proposed and for group 0003, packaging materials of types 0050 (containers) and 0060 (trucks) would be proposed.  
The groupings and packaging material types are freely definable.

Application.title: Application
Application.description:
Application for output conditions  
Identifies the applications from which output can be sent (for example, sales order processing or invoice processing). The output is divided according to output types and assigned to these applications.

OutputDetProc.title: OutputDet.Proc.
OutputDetProc.description:
Output determination procedure  
Defines the output categories (for example, order confirmation and electronic mail message) that are allowed in a document and the sequence in which the output categories appear in the document.

OutputType.title: Output Type
OutputType.description:
Specifies the kind of output to be produced.  
The output type is predefined for your area of the SAP system. If alternative choices are possible, you can list them by pressing F4.  
The output type can specify, for example, a printed form that you need for internal use or a form that you want to send to a customer or vendor (for example, an order confirmation). The output type can also be an internal electronic mail message that you want to send to staff in another department.

MatlGrpPckmat.title: Matl Grp Pckmat
MatlGrpPckmat.description:
Material Group: Packaging Materials  
Groups together materials that require similar packaging materials.  
For example, you could use the term 'liquids' to group together all materials that need to be packed in packaging materials suitable for liquids.

Plant.title: Plant
Plant.description:
Key that identifies a plant uniquely.  
Plant to which the packing material for the handling unit belongs.

ItemCategory.title: Item Category
ItemCategory.description:
Sales Document Item Category  
A classification that distinguishes between different types of item (for example, free of charge items and text items) and determines how the system processes the item.  
The system proposes an item category. If alternatives are defined for your system, you can change the item category manually in the sales document.  
If, for example, you identify an item as a free or charge item, you tell the system, in this case, to ignore normal pricing procedures.

SalesOrg.title: Sales Org.
SalesOrg.description:
Sales Organization  
An organizational unit responsible for the sale of certain products or services. The responsibility of a sales organization may include legal liability for products and customer claims.  
You can assign any number of distribution channels and divisions to a sales organization. A particular combination of sales organization, distribution channel, and division is known as a sales area.

RefDistChCustMat.title: RefDistCh-Cust/Mat.
RefDistChCustMat.description:
Reference distrib.channel for cust.and material masters  
Specifies a distribution channel that you want to use as a reference for customer and material master data for other distribution channels.  
You can specify one distribution channel as the source of customer and material master data for other distribution channels. You need then only to maintain the data in one place.  
Distrib.channel Ref.distrib.channel  
01 01  
02 01  
03 01  
04 04  
In this example, only distribution channels 01 and 04 have customer and material master data defined. Distribution channels 01, 02, and 03 share the master data that you defined for distribution channel 01. Distribution channel 04 has its own master data. When you create a sales order in distribution channel 03, the system checks the customer and material master data against the data defined for distribution channel 01.

LgthLoadingPltf.title: LgthLoadingPltf
LgthLoadingPltf.description: Lgth of loading platform in lgth of LdPlat measurement units

Unitoflength.title: Unit of length
Unitoflength.description: Unit of measure to measure the length of loading platform

StorLocation.title: Stor. Location
StorLocation.description:
Storage Location  
Number of the storage location in which the material is stored. There can be one or more storage locations within a plant.  
Storage location in which the packing material for the handling unit is stored for the purpose of the inventory.  
This storage location can be different to the real storage location of the handling unit.

Wtvolfixed.title: Wt/vol. fixed
Wtvolfixed.description:
Weight and Volume Fixed  
If you select this field, no further weight or volume calculations are carried out for the handling unit.  
It is best to make this setting after the handling unit has been weighed and when you are certain that no more changes will be made to it.

Packmatlcat.title: Pack.matl cat.
Packmatlcat.description:
Packaging Material Category  
Environment:  
Customizing:  
Make an entry here that distinguishes the kind of packaging materials being used.  
Processing/Displaying Handling Units:  
This field contains the packaging material category for the packaging material used in this handling unit.  
If the packaging material is a truck, enter the ID for means of transport. Additional fields such as the driver's name and nationality are then offered for processing when you pack using this kind of packaging material.  
For packaging materials that are also used in the actual packing process (dividers and lids, for example), enter the  ID for auxiliary packaging materials.

CustPckgingMatl.title: CustPckgingMatl
CustPckgingMatl.description:
Partner's (Customer's or Vendor's) Packaging Material  
For inbound deliveries, the partner's material number is derived from the vendor's material information; for outbound deliveries, it is taken from the customer's material information.  
If this information was entered manually, it is not checked.

Object1.title: Object
Object1.description:
Packing Object  
Indicates the object to which the handling unit is currently assigned.  
01 - The handling unit is currently part of an outbound delivery  
02 - Indicates a packing proposal in a sales document  
03 - This handling unit is currently part of an inbound delivery  
04 - Indicates a shipment HU  
06 - The handling unit has no has no document reference. It is a  
non-assigned handling unit and contains no stock information.  
07 - The handling unit has no document reference. It was assembled in  
repetitive manufacturing and goods receipt has not yet been posted.  
08 - This handling unit is assigned to a work order for posting of  
goods issue.  
09 - This handling unit was assembled for a work order for goods  
receipt posting.  
12 - The handling unit has no document reference. This is a  
non-assigned handling unit which contains stock information.

Object2.title: Object
Object2.description:
Key for Object to Which the Handling Unit is Assigned  
Contains the object key of the object that is assigned to the handling unit. If this handling unit is a non-assigned handling unit (not assigned to a document), the contents of this field are irrelevant.  
When non-assigned handling units are created and saved, a number is created for the creation process. This number appears as the object key for the handling units that were created.

Containerstat.title: Container stat.
Containerstat.description:
WM status for container material  
Displays what is to be done with the container material or what has already been done.

Whsenumber.title: Whse number
Whsenumber.description:
Warehouse Number / Warehouse Complex  
Alphanumeric key that identifies a complex physical warehouse within the Warehouse Management System.  
All the activities within the warehouse, such as goods movements and  inventory are assigned to a warehouse number. This key uniquely identifies the physical warehouse in which these activities take place.  
The warehouse number refers to the complete handling unit and is determined from the materials contained in the handling unit. The plant and storage location of the handling unit packing material do not influence the warehouse number of the handling unit.

SAPRelease.title: SAP Release
SAPRelease.description:
Release status of the SAP System for which the screen variant has been generated.  
A screen variant is generated when saving or when a CO actual posting is first called after a release change.

Closed.title: Closed
Closed.description:
Packaging Material is Closed Packaging  
For closed packaging materials, the total volume is not increased by the loading volume of the contents.  
The total volume of a box is the same whether it is full or empty, which makes it a closed packaging material.  
The total volume of a pallet, however, is figured from the tare weight of the pallet itself plus the volume of the goods packed on it. Therefore, pallets are open packaging materials.

DGrelevant.title: DG-relevant
DGrelevant.description:
Packing Level is Relevant for Dangerous Goods  
Indicator to show that the packing level corresponds to the dangerous goods provisions.  
This indicator and the Print-relevant for DG indicator must be set if this packing level is to be marked as relevant for dangerous goods on the packing list.

Printrelevant.title: Print-relevant
Printrelevant.description:
Indicator: Packing level is relevant for printing  
Indicator that you use to specify that this packing level is marked as relevant for dangerous goods on the packing list.  
On the packing list you can print the text Dangerous goods relevant packing level if you have set the DG relevant and Print-relevant for DG indicators.

PackInstructn.title: PackInstructn
PackInstructn.description:
Packing instruction  
Unique identification of a packing instruction.

Locpackstatus.title: Loc.pack.status
Locpackstatus.description: Local packing status for a single HU (without sub HUs)

Noshippinglabel.title: No shipping label
Noshippinglabel.description:
Indicator: do not print external shipping label  
Specifies whether an external shipping label is printed.  
If you set this flag, no external shipping labels are printed.  
However, internal labels are always printed for handling units.

Allowedload.title: Allowed load
Allowedload.description: Maximum weight that can be loaded on a handling unit created using this packing instruction.

HUstatus.title: HU status
HUstatus.description:
Handling unit status  
The handling unit's movement status informs you about the current physical status of the handling unit.

HUstorageloc.title: HU storage loc.
HUstorageloc.description:
Content is Located at an HU-managed Storage Location  
This indicator informs you of the inventory management of the handling unit. The possible values can be found in the input help (F4).  
X The material items of this handling unit are in a HU-managed storage location. All material postings must be made by using handling units.  
This indicator has no effect on handling units that do not contain any material items.

HUsystem.title: HU system
HUsystem.description:
HU and IM Stock in Separate Systems  
This indicator specifies whether the handling unit is managed in the current system and if the inventory that is packed in this handling unit is managed by Inventory Management in this system.

Hold.title: Hold
Hold.description:
Inbound delivery header not yet complete (on Hold)  
Speficifies whether the inbound delivery is a delivery on hold or not.  
Hint:  
Once an inbound delivery has been saved, it cannot be processed with the function Put on Hold at a later point in time.

StatDecntrlWhse.title: StatDecntrlWhse
StatDecntrlWhse.description:
Distribution Status (Decentralized Warehouse Processing)  
This field displays the processing status of the delivery in terms of decentralized Warehouse Management System processing. This field cannot be changed manually. Instead, the system determines the status using delivery items' warehouse numbers and the delivery processing status.  
In the central system, this field may contain the following characteristics:  
' ': delivery is not relevant for distribution to a decentralized WM System.  
'A':  delivery is relevant for distribution in the decentralized system. When the delivery is saved, an IDoc is created. The system then uses this IDoc to distribute the delivery in the decentralized system.  
'B':  delivery was distributed in the decentralized system and is currently being processed there.  
'C':  processing of the delivery in the decentralized system is complete. Any changes are confirmed in the central system.  
'D': The delivery is planned for distribution in the decentralized system. You can trigger distribution using the delivery monitor.  
'E': The delivery was subsequently split in the decentralized system. In this case, no further changes can be made to the document in the central system.  
'F':  Change management was subsequently switched off. For example, because the central system was temporarily not available. The delivery can no longer be changed in the central system.  
This field may contain the following characteristics in the decentralized Warehouse Management System:  
'A':  delivery is being processed.  
'C':  processing of this delivery in the decentral system is complete. The delivery is confirmed in the central system via goods issue or goods receipt posting. The delivery can no longer be changed in the decentral system.  
'E': The delivery was split in the decentralized system. The delivery can then be changed, however, only changes to the delivery quantity are returned to the central system.  
'F':  Change management was subsequently switched off. The delivery can only be changed in the decentralized system. Only changes to the delivery quantity are reported back to the central system.  
Statuses 'B' and 'D' do not occur in this system.

Del.title: Del.
Del.description:
Delete indicator for the confirmation of deleted HUs  
Represents the deletion indicator for the handling units (HUs) deleted by the confirmation.  
This indicator serves to delete selected HUs from the ABAP Dictionary at a later date in a background task.

Delivery.title: Delivery
Delivery.description: The number that uniquely identifies the delivery.

Item.title: Item
Item.description:
Item number of the SD document  
The number that uniquely identifies the item in the sales, shipping, or billing document.

SerialNumber.title: Serial Number
SerialNumber.description:
Specifies the serial number of a serialized material.  
You can use the serial number to identify individual instances of a material for individual tracking purposes.  
A prerequisite for using a serial number in the logistical process is a serial number profile at material plant level.

UII.title: UII
UII.description:
Unique Item Identifier  
Displays the unique item identifier (UII), a globally unique number that identifies a single item.

Delivery.title: Delivery
Delivery.description: The number that uniquely identifies the delivery.

Item.title: Item
Item.description:
Delivery Item  
The number that uniquely identifies the item in a delivery.

ShipmentNumber.title: Shipment Number
ShipmentNumber.description:
Identifies the shipment document.  
If, during processing of a shipment document, numbers starting with '$' appear, these are temporary shipment numbers. When you save, the actual shipment document numbers are assigned.

text1.title: Char20
text1.description:
Text Line  
The actual text is stored in the field TDLINE. Depending on the format field of the respective line, the line contents are interpreted as  
text  
control command or  
comment  
All control information which can be contained in a SAPscript text line must be represented with readable characters. Hex codes which cannot be displayed on the screen should not be used. If this is the case however, the results of SAPscript functions may not be ideal.  
Normal text lines can contain 2 types of 'control information':  
character formats  
symbols  
Character formats define the formatting of characters or character strings within a paragraph. They are preceded by the escape symbol <x> or <xx> and concluded by the character </>. If the end sequence is missing, the character format applies up to the end of the paragraph. Character formats can be nested. 'x' or 'xx' are the format keys of the character formats. They are defined in either the assigned style or layout set. Character formats defined by the user can only consist of the letters A to Z and numbers 0 to 9, where the first character must always be a letter.  
In addition to the character formats which can be freely defined, there are also formats defined by SAPscript:  
<(> and <)>  
The characters located between these character formats are output unchanged. Character strings themselves and symbols can therefore be included in the output. This character format corresponds to the raw line paragraph format.  
A character which cannot be entered using the keyboard can therefore be output. 'x' is the number of an SAP character. All characters which can be used in the SAP System have a unique number. The character can only be printed or displayed on the screen if it is also defined in the system character set and is contained in the appropriate character set of the output device.  
Symbols are placeholders for values which are not inserted until output formatting. Symbols must have a specific structure so that they can be recognized:  
Symbols must be preceded and followed by & characters.  
Blanks are not allowed in symbol names.  
The symbol must fit fully in the field TDLINE.  
...  
These are only the most important requirements. Symbols can also contain additional options for formatting which are however not explained here as a more extensive description would be required.

PONumber.title: PO Number
PONumber.description:
Customer Purchase Order Number  
Number that the customer uses to uniquely identify a purchasing document (e.g. an inquiry or a purchase order).  
The number creates the link between the customer purchase order and the sales document that you create. You can use the number used by the customer during correspondence with the customer to find certain document information. If the number refers to a purchase order, you can also print it on the documents that you send to the customer (e.g. on the delivery note).
